description: Number of partitions of n^2 into squares.
comments: Is limit_{n->inf} a(n)^(1/n) > 1? - _Paul D. Hanna_, Aug 20 2002Conjecture for A001156 by Bohman, Fröberg and Riesel (1979), modified for this sequence: a(n) ~ c * n^(-2*alfa) * exp(beta*n^(2/3)), where c = 1/18.79656, beta = 3.30716, alfa = 1.16022 [If this conjecture true, the limit above is equal to 1]. - _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Aug 19 2015
links: T. D. Noe and Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..500 (terms n = 0..100 from T. D. Noe)
J. Bohman et al., Partitions in squares, Nordisk Tidskr. Informationsbehandling (BIT) 19 (1979), 297-301.
H. L. Fisher, Letter to N. J. A. Sloane, Mar 16 1989
formula: a(n) = A001156(n^2) = coefficient of x^(n^2) in the series expansion of prod(k>=1, 1/(1 - x^(k^2)) ).
maple: b:= proc(n, i) option remember; `if`(n=0 or i=1, 1,      b(n, i-1) +`if`(i^2>n, 0, b(n-i^2, i)))    end:a:= n-> b(n^2, n):seq(a(n), n=0..40);  # _Alois P. Heinz_, Apr 15 2013
mathematica: max=33; se = Series[ Product[1/(1-x^(k^2)), {k, 1, max}], {x, 0, max^2}]; a[n_] := Coefficient[se, x^(n^2)]; a[0] = 1; Table[a[n], {n, 0, max}] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Oct 18 2011 *)
prog: (Haskell)a037444 n = p (map (^ 2) [1..]) (n^2) where   p _      0 = 1   p ks'@(k:ks) m | m < k     = 0                  | otherwise = p ks' (m - k) + p ks m-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Aug 14 2011
crossrefs: Entries with square index in A001156.
A row or column of the array in A259799.
author: _Wouter Meeussen_
